alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hamilton; Johnson; Pope; Saline; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 5:10PM CDT until March 30 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Pope County in southern Illinois... Johnson County in southern Illinois... Williamson County in southern Illinois... Saline County in southern Illinois... Franklin County in south central Illinois... Hamilton County in south central Illinois... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 509 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near West City to near Karnak, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Marion, Mcleansboro, Benton, and Vienna. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 23. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 40 and 80. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central, southern and southeastern Illinois...and western Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central, southern and southeastern Illinois...and western Kentucky.
